speaker: Camp
lines: You raise a windbreak from old sledge boards and torn canvas.
A small flame crackles; tea melts the ache from your hands.
From here the Glacier Pass curves to the east, a river of blue glass.
West yawns a limestone maw—the Echo Caverns—where breath returns as whispers.
Bootprints you do not remember making cross and recross the snow, already half-filled.
Sparks climb the dark like tiny stars seeking their constellations again.

choices.text: Study the slope and steel yourself (rest).
